questions.question: If I had picked an investment with potential for large gains but also the risk of large losses I would feel

answers.c: Accepting of the possible highs and lows
answers.d: Excited by the potential for gain

questions.question: Imagine that six months after making a <u>long term investment</u> the financial markets start to perform badly. In line with this, your own investment goes down by a significant amount. What would your reaction be?

answers.a: Withdraw my money and put it in a bank deposit account to prevent any further losses.
answers.b: Transfer my money to a more secure investment option to reduce the risk of further losses.
answers.c: Monitor the investment and wait to see if it improves before deciding what to do
answers.d: Invest more funds to take advantage of the lower price, expecting future growth
answers.e: Transfer my money to a riskier investment, with possible higher return, to try to recoup my losses.

questions.question: When I make a financial investment I normally feel

answers.c: Sometimes optimistic and sometimes a bit concerned
answers.f: I have never made an investment other than a savings account

questions.question: Which of these statements best applies to you?

answers.a: I have a portfolio of shares that I actively manage.
answers.b: I own, or owned, a small number of shares and have found it a good financial experience
answers.c: I owned shares in the past but felt uncomfortable with the movement up and down in their value
answers.d: I have never owned shares but would like to if I had spare cash.
answers.e: I have never owned shares and would not want to.

questions.question: How would a close friend describe your attitude to taking financial risks?
Investment X has the potential to make a lot of money but also has a higher chance of losing money. If you had money to invest, how much would you be willing to put in an investment like this?
If you were making an investment, what amount of risk would you be prepared to take with your financial investments in order to see potential gain?

answers.a: A very small amount, if any

questions.question: Which of these statements best applies to you?

answers.a: I own or owned, an investment property that I rent out and found it a good financial experience.
answers.b: I owned investment properties in the past but felt uncomfortable with the risk of rent not being paid or unexpected expenses.
answers.c: I have never owned an investment property but would like to if I had spare cash.
answers.d: I have never owned an investment property and would not want to.

questions.question: I find it interesting to explore investment opportunities for my money.

answers.b: I tend to agree with this statement.
answers.c: I neither agree nor disagree with this statement
answers.d: I tend to disagree with this statement.

questions.question: I want my investment money to be safe even if it means lower returns in the long run.

answers.b: I tend to agree with this statement
answers.c: I neither agree nor disagree with this statement
answers.d: I tend to disagree with this statement.

questions.question: Have you ever invested a sum of money which you needed, for the excitement of seeing how it would perform over time?

answers.a: No, I would not take that kind of risk.
answers.b: No, but I would have if I had the money.
